Description: Egyptian terracotta figure of Harpocrates wearing a headdress (two lotus buds) carrying a jar. Mould-made and hollow, with vent on back. Red slip or paint covers much of figure. Brown Nile silt fabric with red core. Abundant fine gold mica, quartz, organics and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Probably made in Naukratis. Similar to a mid 2nd century BC Harpocrates found at Krokodeilonpolis-Arsinoe (Bayer-Niemeier 1988, pl. 5.3, no. 30). Bayer-Niemeier, E. 1988. Liebieghaus Museum Alter Plastik. Bildwerke der Sammlung Kaufmann, 1. Griechisch-römische Terrakotten. Melsungen.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.052) (Phase 1)
